Reviews.Content: Unbeatable location and terrace Extremely convenient location - just a few steps from the duomo. Unbelievable view from the rooftop terrace - best enjoyed with a bottle of wine, which they provided for us! Room was small and bathroom even smaller but was still adequate for us, particularly considering how close everything was. The noise from the street was quite loud but was mostly blocked out by closing the window.
Reviews.Author: SydneyWarey

Reviews.Content: Good news- bad news       Nighttime view from rooftop terrace
Reviews.Author: frizzylee

Reviews.Content: A good location       bathroom
Reviews.Author: travelsitaly

Reviews.Content: Not for the elderly No elevator/lift. Up 2 flights of steep stairs. I was travelling with my elderly parents and had to cancel at the last minute once we found the facility. Very difficult to locate among a road of brightly lit hotel signs. There was no place to properly stop on the road to unload luggage because of barriers. I am very dissapointed. Went and stayed at another hotel.
Reviews.Author: biya1218

Reviews.Content: Spectacular view, great place! We stayed three nights at La Cupola and enjoyed our stay very much. Not all rooms have a view on the Duomo but the terrace is accessible to all guests and has THE view over Florence;you are facing the cathedral and have San Lorenzo on your right. We brought pizzas and wine during the evening for a much needed chillout time after intense sightseeing. Our room was very clean and has your average furniture and a ceiling fan. It is very good value for money as it's located 5 minutes away from the train station and in the centre of the city. The breakfast is in a typical Italian caf茅, you are served good coffee and a pastry. The owner was very helpful and went out of his way to make us feel at home, we spoke Italian so communication wasn't a problem. We didn't have time to see everything and when we return, we'll definitely stay there again!
Reviews.Author: pknta

Reviews.Content: Only for those on a budget The BB is well situated on a main street leading from the station (SMN) to the Duomo. It is on the second floor with a roof terrace 2 further flights up. There are 6 rooms, there were 4 of us and we rented two double rooms. All rooms are ensuite but the bathrooms (with shower only) are quite small. Our actual room had the smallest bathroom it was possible to construct, with shower, toilet and cracked sink all in line in a narrow galley. Bending over the sink meant you backed onto the door and using the shower meant you had to step over the toilet. Actually using the toilet meant your knees touched the wall and required some flexibility!We were only staying 2 nights and as no other rooms were available decided to stick it out. We did find out on the second night that there was a separate bathroom that could be used. This must have been explained to another guest, as there was a set of false teeth in a glass on the sink later that night!!Our room could only be rated as 1/5. The other room we booked and the remaining rooms were typically 2/5 and the sheets were changed during our 2 nights visit. The Venere website shows a triple/quad room looking down the street towards the Duomo, this is their best room. The view from the terrace is very good but does not compensate for our room, although as mentioned the others have more acceptable bathrooms. The owner was very helpful, but the attending staff do not speak English, although only basic communication was necessary. The breakfast vouchers are for use at a cafe-bar across the street, but only 1 croissant etc and coffee was available.I could only recommend this BB for those on a budget, but not room number 5.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
